programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan asks general knowledge questions against the clock as Susan Calman, Lawrence Chaney, Harry Pinero, James Argent, Mike Wozniak, OJ Borg, Sherrie Hewson and Raj Bisram try to win money for charity

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Anton Du Beke, Emma Barton, Will Kirk, Lucia Scalisi, Eric Knowles, Caroline Hawley, YolanDa Brown and Jonathan Ansell try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max has discovered that someone has been stealing Diazepam, and proposes new rules to restrict access - a move that threatens to cut off Faith's supply and bring her secrets into the light. When Cam forgets to sign for a patient's morphine, Stevie becomes suspicious that he is behind the missing drugs. Donna's conscience is troubled further when a familiar patient is checked in

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Vita's musical career continues to blossom following her performance in Jamaica, but Yemi warns that the price of success may be turning her back on her dysfunctional family. Dawn demands to know where all Bosco's money has gone, forcing Beres to admit the truth - the Champion Crown contract grants him complete control of all his son's future earnings

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Nottingham Forest at Emirates Stadium and Brighton & Hove Albion v Luton Town at AMEX Stadium. Last season's runners-up Arsenal invested heavily in the summer on the likes of Declan Rice and Kai Havertz, and will have expected to get off to a winning start. Meanwhile, Championship play-off winners Luton made their Premier debut against a team that impressed last term. Plus, Burnley v Manchester City, Bournemouth v West Ham United, Everton v Fulham, Newcastle United v Aston Villa and Sheffield United v Crystal Palace

programme.title: Highlander (1986)
programme.desc: A 16th-century Scottish clansman discovers he is one of a race of immortal warriors who can only be killed by beheading, and who are destined to fight to the death until just one survives. Centuries later in modern-day New York, he prepares for a final showdown with his deadliest enemy. Fantasy action adventure, starring Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Clancy Brown and Roxanne Hart. Featuring a soundtrack by Queen

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Nottingham Forest at Emirates Stadium and Brighton & Hove Albion v Luton Town at AMEX Stadium. Last season's runners-up Arsenal invested heavily in the summer on the likes of Declan Rice and Kai Havertz, and will have expected to get off to a winning start. Meanwhile, Championship play-off winners Luton made their Premier debut against a team that impressed last term. Plus, Burnley v Manchester City, Bournemouth v West Ham United, Everton v Fulham, Newcastle United v Aston Villa and Sheffield United v Crystal Palace

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Cameras follow Ivor as he celebrates his 83rd birthday by having a second bar mitzvah, which happens to coincide with his 13-year-old grandson Zak's first bar mitzvah. The preparations for this milestone event take Ivor on a trip down memory lane - to the area where he grew up, the market where he worked for 40 years, and the grave of his beloved wife. Now he's happily living with his new partner of 12 years, Rita, the bar mitzvah is the perfect opportunity to take stock of his life and make the most of growing older

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Four friends take on a terraced house in Crewe. A former shop in the Cumbrian village of Glasson and a three bedroom terraced house in Gnosall in Staffordshire are also refurbished

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Newark, Nottinghamshire, with experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. Featuring a look at the profitable field of police memorabilia

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum visits the historical and religious sites of Colchester, Britain's oldest recorded town since its foundation during the Roman occupation of Britain over 2000 years. Laura Wright visits FACT (Fellowship Afloat Christian Trust) and finds out how, using outdoor activities, they provide a space to reach young people, who might not come into contact with traditional church life

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At Walsall Recycling Centre in the West Midlands, Jay Blades finds a pair of chairs, a collection of metal racks and drawers, a school desk and a collection of brass lighting

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown guides a couple on a house hunt in Bedfordshire. He visits Biggleswade to find out about an accessible off road, multi-user path that circumnavigates the market town

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: On Zambia's plains, a cheetah mother must keep her cubs safe, preparing them for life without her. They take on dangerous prey and learn that even tiny neighbours can bite back

programme.title: Ghostbusters II (1989)
programme.desc: The eccentric spectre-hunters reunite to save New York from a massive river of slime generated by the citizens' negativity and nasty thoughts. Meanwhile, the spirit of a 16th-century tyrant tries to return to the land of the living by possessing the body of a toddler. Sequel to the supernatural comedy, starring Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis and Ernie Hudson

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Hamza Yassin are in Renfrewshire, joined by Edith Bowman, who will be the judge of this year's entries to the Countryfile photographic competition. John also meets Cyanotype artist Martha Orbach to uncover the origins of nature photography and visits a Glaswegian community collective. Hamza reveals a simple butterfly feeder to support wildlife, and Adam Henson has some tough decisions over what to grow after harvest

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Sefton Park Palm House in Liverpool, and discovers the history of the house. Finds include a rare double Ming Dynasty vase bought in a charity shop, some valuable Beatles memorabilia, a Grand Tour Bronze, some unusual Finnish glass, a painting by George Melly, and a silver disc brought in by one of the members of Gerry and the Pacemakers.

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: As the siege drags on in Tobruk, Harry leads a mission to find a source of drinking water. While they are successful in finding a well, tragedy strikes when they are caught out by a German ambush. In Manchester, Kasia is confronted by further horror of war when she discovers Irena's motives for spying for the Nazis. In France, romance blossoms between David and Henriette as they hide out in a farm

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Brentford v Tottenham Hotspur at Gtech Community Stadium and Chelsea v Liverpool at Stamford Bridge. Both previous meetings between Brentford and Spurs at this ground had ended level, while the last four contests involving the Blues and Liverpool in all competitions had been goalless. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original

programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Take Me to the Opera
programme.desc: Zeinab Badawi meets Sir Bryn Terfel, one of the most distinguished singers of our age. A star who is in demand on stages across the world, Bryn has stayed true to his Welsh roots and is a great proponent for Welsh culture. He invites Zeinab behind the scenes not only at the Royal Opera House where he is a regular performer, but also in his native Wales where he still lives and where he is recording an album of traditional folk songs. He was chosen personally by King Charles to sing at his coronation. Zeinab visits the Welsh National Opera which launched Bryn's international career and speaks to WNO general director, Aidan Lang who oversaw his debut performance. The WNO's touring wardrobe manager Judith Russell, shows Zeinab Sir Bryn's costume as Falstaff in the opera by Verdi and explains how she was tasked with dressing him for this iconic role. We meet young Welsh singers performing at the same local singing competitions that Bryn sang in as a young boy and ask how he inspires them t

programme.title: Episode One
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, this documentary follows a remarkable project spearheaded by His Majesty King Charles III, who has commissioned ten leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of ten pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The completed portraits will become part of the Royal Collection and stand as a lasting memorial to all the men, women and children who came to Britain from the Caribbean and gave so much of themselves to rebuild a nation devasted by war. Featuring first-person testimony from the Windrush sitters, many of whom are in their 90s, as they speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain; making lives for themselves and the overwhelming contribution they have made to their communities and the nation as a whole. The film also follows the making of the portraits, as artist and sitter come together, with the artists reflecting on their own experience of und

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: Pip and Posy have fun playing in the snow but forget that Frankie doesn’t enjoy it. How can they make it fun for him too?

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: Tusk is trying to paint a portrait of Ping Wing, but throws away his attempts, which float through the air and end up with the other animals in the forest

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

However, the first the band know about the infant is when the girl disappears, leaving them to look after it. programme.desc: Jack is taken hostage while interviewing a suspect, but somehow manages to talk his way out of trouble - quite an achievement for a man whose lack of tact is legendary. programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death by a giant box during a magic show organised by famous illusionist Gideon Latimer, pathologist Kate discovers the cables had been deliberately sabotaged. Evangelising curate Andrew Maplin claims the tragedy is God's vengeance for the pagan traditions still held deep in Midsomer Oaks, but Barnaby and Nelson fear Gideon was the real target. Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee and Tamzin Malleson star in the murder mystery, with Joe Absolom, Andrew-Lee Potts, Justin Salinger, Amanda Burton and Stephanie Leonidas

However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian-style garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires that someone has blocked the mountainside channels on which the new garden will rely for its supply of water, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Judi Dench's Wild Borneo Adventure
programme.desc: The actress journeys more than 560km down Borneo's Kinabatangan river and along the island's coastline to explore the unique wildlife that lives in this threatened environment. With scientist Kerisha Kntayya, Judi joins a crocodile hunt with a difference. Kerisha plucks young crocodiles out of the water. Judi then joins Kerisha's team as they wrestle an adult croc as part of the study Kerisha hopes will help save these prehistoric creatures. The Oscar winner, who's had a fascination with bats from an early age, also explores the Gomantong cave, home to more than a million bats

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As Joanna's Silk Road Adventure draws to a close, she travels across the Central Asian states of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. Starting in the Kyzylkum desert, she explores the citadel of Khiva, a town infamous for its history of slavery. A high-speed train then whisks her to the magnificent 14th-century architecture of Samarkand, before heading to mountainous Kyrgyzstan, where she meets DJs, K-Pop groups, eagle hunters and yak herders. Finally, her journey ends near the Chinese border, at the old Silk Road caravanserai of Tash Rabat

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The discovery of a 2,000-year-old body provides fresh evidence in a five-year-old unsolved missing persons case, so Morse and Thursday take up the investigation, discovering a possible link to a local pagan ritual to celebrate the harvest. The investigation leads them to a nuclear power station, where they face a conspiracy of silence concerning an experimental new reactor and a potential disaster that could devastate Oxford. Guest starring Sheila Hancock, widow of original Inspector Morse star John Thaw

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: After finding Alfred on the doorstep of Bellamy House, Rose shelters him in a storeroom and gives him food. When Hudson learns of the former footman's presence, his story is investigated - but all the staff below stairs are threatened by what transpires

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Timid new student nurse Faye Clark is faced with a trying first day when a model collapses after taking magic mushrooms. Lizzie falls for an injured motorcycle stuntman who is convinced he is destined to live fast and die young due to a hereditary condition - but Ormerod comes up with a different diagnosis. Lauren Drummond, Michelle Hardwick, James Daffern and Robert Daws star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A cancer patient dies unexpectedly after a visit from Dr Ormerod and the grieving family points the finger at him - leading to his arrest on suspicion of murder. Dr Ellis holds a clinic at the prison and becomes trapped when a riot breaks out, while Faye has to overcome her fear of needles to give Jack a tetanus shot. Hospital drama, starring Robert Daws, Neil McDermott, Lauren Drummond and Gareth Hale

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Oliver regrets an act of kindness when he offers to help a poorly Simon recover from a cold

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: A look back at a selection of sports covered by ITV during the 1980s, ranging from football and boxing to wrestling and double decker racing

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is offered the chance to buy a cheap Daimler, but while trying to locate its dealer's elusive premises is arrested for kerb-crawling. With a gross of red light bulbs in his boot, the evidence seems compelling, and even Ray begins to doubt his uncle's innocence. Nevertheless, the loyal nephew sets out to track down the so-called Goodtime garage to provide corroboration. Lighthearted drama, with George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A bad dream has Regan's girlfriend fearing for his safety, and her visions ring true when he gets involved in a case involving a stolen lorryload of cigars. The plot thickens when illicit cocaine is retrieved and arms stolen from the US are discovered to be on their way to a military faction in Ireland. John Thaw and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: The Champions
programme.desc: Craig, Richard and Sharron investigate the disappearance of three Nemesis agents on a tropical island. Fantasy drama, starring Stuart Damon, William Gaunt and Alexandra Bastedo

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert of Huntingdon assumes the mantle of Robin Hood as the re-formed band of outlaws resolves to rescue Marion from Clun. Fantasy drama, starring Jason Connery, with Ray Winstone, Judi Trott and Phil Davis

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: The Hawaii-based detective is hired by a beautiful woman to protect her and a valuable antique vase. Drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team responds to a farm SOS, when a skid loader slides into a dam, as well as an extreme helicopter salvage mission that requires access to a protected nature reserve

programme.title: The Champions
programme.desc: Richard infiltrates a mysterious agency in a risky bid to investigate the audacious assassination of several world leaders. Fantasy drama, starring William Gaunt, Alexandra Bastedo and Stuart Damon

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: The men send for Marion when Robert is badly wounded in a raid. Meanwhile, the Sheriff of Nottingham is eager to prove that Robert is the outlaws' leader - already being referred to by the people as Robin Hood

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A group of schoolgirls hire Magnum to find their missing teacher, only to be caught stealing a valuable oil painting. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A former criminal and friend of Regan's wins a large amount of money on the pools - but then receives blackmailing phone calls regarding a crime from 11 years earlier for which he was never caught. Hard-hitting drama, guest starring Edward Judd, with John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur swaps the contents of his lock-up for a slot-machine full of stolen money during a trip to the fair. Unfortunately the incriminating item is passed to Morley, who uses it at a charity event, and a showdown between cops and robbers ensues. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole, Nicholas Day and Gary Webster

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team has been given just two days and a 20 thousand dollar budget to remove a 10-metre steel-hulled yacht from Cockburn Beach in Western Australia. The problem is the boat is buried deep in the sand and it's a danger to beach goers. Heavy machinery specialist Ryan is going to use his monster excavator to try and get the job done. However, to make the budget work, he needs to be done and dusted in 24 hours

programme.title: World Series of Darts
programme.desc: Action from day one of the sixth round of the series, which takes place at WIN Entertainment Centre in Wollongong, Australia. Eight seeded players faced eight of the best players from Australia and New Zealand to compete for a quarter-final spot. Commentary by Stuart Pyke, Mark Webster and Dan Dawson

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. The discovery of a new variant of Covid-19 causes chaos in Heathrow as airports around the world begin to close their borders to the UK. As flights are cancelled before the passengers' eyes, they scramble to get on any available plane in a desperate attempt to get home

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Heathrow readies itself for a flurry of passengers as it's announced that holidaymakers can travel to 12 new countries. To keep Britain safe - and to keep it as simple for passengers as possible - a new traffic light system has come into operation, dividing Heathrow's 206 destinations into colours. Passenger Service Manager Demi is tasked with helping the many confused passengers, including one very agitated granny-to-be who has been turned away from her flight and isn't going quietly. The airport police are also hard at work as Sergeant Dawson is on the search for a missing child in Terminal 2

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A member of a group of convicts slips off the roof and dies during a robbery. The apparent leader of the gang appears to be having doubts about his life and Regan senses he is deliberately pointing clues in a desire to be caught during his next job. John Thaw and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin introduces some of the great racehorses of the modern era, including Nijinsky, Tiger Roll, Best Mate, Desert Orchid and Shergar

programme.title: Hornblower
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama, which sees CS Forester's seafaring hero crossing swords with tyrannical Captain James Sawyer, an officer on the brink of madness. Reprimanded for falling asleep while on watch, young Horatio partly redeems himself by saving the Renown from seemingly certain disaster _ but ends up charged with mutiny. Ioan Gruffudd, Robert Lindsay and David Warner star

programme.title: MotoGP Highlights
programme.desc: The British Grand Prix. Action from the ninth round of the season, which took place at Silverstone

programme.title: ITV Racing: The Opening Show
programme.desc: Oli Bell and the team are at Ascot to preview the Shergar Cup, as four teams prepare to battle it out to be crowned as champions

programme.title: Best of Saint & Greavsie: FA Cup Special
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable moments from the popular series, featuring an interview with newly appointed Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson, and an on location feature with Seve Ballesteros

programme.title: The Big Match Revisited
programme.desc: Brian Moore introduces highlights from January 1978, including Chelsea v Ipswich Town in the feature match, Everton v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Manchester United v Derby County

programme.title: Made in Britain

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani presents coverage of the Shergar Cup from Ascot, as some of the sport's leading jockeys represent teams from around the world. There is also action at Haydock Park, including the Rose of Lancaster Stakes, and the Sweet Solera Stakes is the feature at Newmarket. With analysis from Leonna Mayor, Kevin Blake and Megan Nicholls, reports by Oli Bell and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: World Series of Darts
programme.desc: Action from day two of the sixth round of the series, which took place at WIN Entertainment Centre in Wollongong, Australia, where the quarter-finals, semi-finals and final were all scheduled to take place in this session. Jonny Clayton was crowned champion in 2022, first overcoming current world title-holder Michael Smith in the last eight, before losing just two more legs in total in emphatic victories over Joe Cullen and James Wade in the semi-finals and showpiece match respectively. Commentary by Stuart Pyke, Mark Webster and Dan Dawson

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Coventry City v Middlesbrough, Hull City v Sheffield Wednesday, and Ipswich Town v Stoke City in the Championship, plus a round-up of all the goals and talking points from League One and League Two

programme.title: The Purge (2013)
programme.desc: The American government responds to rising crime rates by introducing an annual 12-hour period when all laws are suspended, so the people can get violent impulses out of their system. A family takes shelter at home, but when a stranger turns up asking for help, the mayhem outside soon catches up with them. Horror, starring Lena Headey and Ethan Hawke

programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents coverage of the 19th, 20th and 21st races of the season from Knockhill. The NAPA Racing UK trio of Dan Cammish, Ash Sutton and Dan Rowbottom were in commanding form last time out at Croft, but title-holder Tom Ingram maintained his pursuit of three-time champion Ash Sutton. Commentary comes from David Addison, Tim Harvey, Richard John Neil and Paul O'Neill, with Louise Goodman reporting from the pit lane

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: A selection of the best World Cup Goals through the years - beginning with Geoff Hurst's hat-trick for England in 1966, right up to the 2018 World Cup in Russia

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: On the Canada-US border lies a vast lake that hides a dark history. For Native Americans it's an ancient and sacred site, but recently something has risen up from the depths to attack swimmers, and stories abound of an invasion of primordial bloodsuckers. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade plunges into the heart of a waterfall in the Pacific Northwest on a mission to catch the oldest river monster of his career

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Coventry City v Tottenham Hotspur. Ian St John and Jimmy Greaves hosted coverage of the 1987 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which proved to be one of the most memorable showpiece matches in the competition's history. With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore

programme.title: Live LaLiga
programme.desc: Getafe v Barcelona (Kick-off 8.30pm). Semra Hunter presents coverage of the opening match of the Spanish top-flight campaign for both teams, held at Coliseum Alfonso Perez. Barca are the reigning champions, having finished an impressive 10 points clear of rivals Real Madrid last season. Getafe ended the season in 15th place, with a four-match unbeaten run in their final fixtures saving them from relegation. With analysis from Guillem Balague and Albert Ferrer, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Terry Gibson

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II (1985)
programme.desc: Incarcerated Special Forces veteran John Rambo is offered the chance for freedom by former commander Colonel Trautman if he takes up the offer to return to the jungles of Vietnam on a life-or-death mission to rescue American PoWs. During the course of the operation, he develops strong feelings for his guide, a female freedom fighter - but tragedy strikes, leaving him more determined than ever to exact a bloody and explosive revenge. Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul, Steven Berkoff, George Kee Cheung, Andy Wood and Martin Kove

programme.desc: George takes Dave on an adventure camping, but Dave isn't sure it's a great idea. He's proved right when they both wake up in a bear's cave.

programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave has a bad day and tells a news reporter that Grimsby is rubbish - when his words are aired on the news, his whole seaside town turns against him. With the help of his friends and a rogue fox, Dave attempts to make amends by shooting a film about all of the great things that Grimsby has to offer.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB sets Lloyd up in a fight with Dotty the ladybird's brother Freckles - worried that he'll defeat a little ladybird with ease, Lloyd makes himself as weak and unfit as possible to make the fight fairer, but Freckles is not the weak opponent he expected...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. A Super Villain called Bad Bzzz - half human/half bumblebee - has chosen Sam and Mo's school as a base... to wrap kids up like cocoons! Brother and sister are astonished: WHOA! They have an authentic, truly evil Super Villain to fight? They're helped by Granny Wanda, who coaches them in essential Super-Hero rules... but eventually, they discover Bad Bzzz's true identity...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam botches her presentation of The Kanuktakaï Harvesters, a board game she found in her gran's attic and fixed up. To make up for her mistake, she invokes the power to go back in time. But the process is uncontrollable and she and Mo end up stuck ten years in the past... before Sam was even born!

programme.desc: The gang investigates the Dreamweaver, who is causing citizens to destroy the things they love the most

programme.desc: Fizz is at the pool, he wants to start sub-marine hairdressing! But Magoo, thinks he is fishing in a lake, and starts trying to catch Weasel.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Lucas' dad is so cool - that must be why Lucas is cool! The kids finally understand that they need cool dads to be cool, but it doesn't look good for them - the only thing they can hope to do is to lie... and make everyone believe that their dads are super-famous! The bigger the lie, the bigger the prize... but it's gonna be tricky, especially when their dads find out when everyone is together at the mall.

programme.title: Smarty Pants

The three boys want to do the same and decide to take care of Granny Farte - it'll be easy and everyone will finally think they're cool... however, when they get to the retirement home, Granny Farte is too busy and suggests that they take care of another old lady known as the cantankerous Danielle.

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother who look to solve police investigations. programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To make the world's biggest fries, Fizz invents the Fizzometer. But Weasel messes up and shrinks Fizz! Magoo is fascinated by all things tiny.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo likes the idea of having fresh eggs every morning, but his newly adopted hen Jeanine has disappeared! He goes to Weasel's house and mistakes Fizz for the bird!

Joe vows this will not happen to him - later on, at Siobhan's Halloween party, she tells an even scarier story about Little Lara Longmore and how she appears to you if you say 'pickled onion' four times.

programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Tata gets on Kuma's shoulders and succeeds in disguising them as the perfect human, and so the pair leave for the mart. programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: A cat-like creature is rumoured to be haunting the halls where a dog show is being held, so Scooby takes the gang to investigate

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Shaggy and Scooby are excited to visit a scary haunted old castle in Germany the rest of the gang are confused until they meet up with none other than famous chef writer and TV presenter Alton Brown! Shaggy Scooby and Alton are good friends (mostly because they will happily eat any experimental scientific food experiment Alton comes up with). Alton Brown is on the trail of his ancestor mad scientist Dr. Cornelius Frankenfooder! It's said he made a crazy Monster from animated foodstuffs that haunts this old castle to this day. Mr. Brown has to get to the bottom of this familial mystery. Obviously our gang is on board to help. Come for the kooky scientific food creations. Stay for the horrible monster! It's definitely a mystery our gang can sink their teeth into…hopefully before the monster sinks its teeth into our gang!

programme.desc: Another glimpse into the lives of expats who have left the UK for a new life in the Spanish sun. Cabaret star Mark - who appears on stage as Ruby Rox - films a video to play as part of his show, and sisters Vina and Nilam launch a business selling spice kits so expats can make their own curries. Tattoo artists Blane and Mark are in need of more customers, while retiree and metal detector enthusiast Stan spends his evenings searching the beaches for small change

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Traversing the Baltic on board the Viking Sky, Jane takes full advantage of the ship's amenities. Her first stop is Tallinn in Estonia, a medieval town with much ancient architecture. Next up is St Petersburg in Russia, where Jane heads to the Hermitage Museum, hoping to spot the cats that traditionally live in the basement. The third stop is Helsinki in Finland, where Jane meets a woman whose ambition is to kiss a brown bear. Finally, the ship pulls into the Swedish capital of Stockholm for one of the highlights of the singer's journey - a guided tour around the Abba Museum

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: When All-Inclusive Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: From endless food and drink to hotels with kids' clubs and water parks, going all-inclusive is supposed to be all about hassle-free fun in the sun. But for some, this option proves anything but relaxing. Here cameras follow the unlucky holidaymakers whose breaks went horribly wrong. They include nurse Julia Vaughan, who spent more than £5,500 on a relaxing break in Crete for herself and her family, only to be confronted by a giant construction site next to their hotel

programme.title: Beatrice and Eugenie: Surviving Controversy
programme.desc: A profile of the sisters, who have been vilified, mocked, satirised and trolled for their clothes, looks, privilege and holidays, but probably most of all for simply being the children of the Duke and Duchess of York. The documentary looks at how close to reality public perception of the princesses actually is, with archive footage and interviews with royal insiders and people who know them

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: The actor looks at how a grief-stricken Queen Victoria fled the palace after Prince Albert died in 1861, revealing how the government persuaded her to return for the residence's first-ever public garden party in 1868. Elsewhere, Raksha Dave tracks down the first flushing toilet installed at the palace, and JJ Chalmers struggles to learn Queen Victoria's favourite waltz

programme.title: The Curse of the Spencers
programme.desc: Documentary examining the difficult upbringing of Diana, Princess of Wales, exploring how her parents' explosive relationship shaped the child who would become a global icon. Combining insights from those closest to the family with powerful reconstruction of some of the most defining and dramatic moments of their lives, the programme uncover the striking parallels between Diana's love story and her parents', and how both troubled relationships unfolded and ended in tragedy

programme.title: Top of the Pops: Most Shocking Moments
programme.desc: The dark side of the long-running music show, exploring the ruthless tactics of promoters and the demands of big name stars, the artists that admitted to performing drunk on-air, and how one presenter hosted the show drugged. Featuring contributions from former presenters Pete Murray, 'Diddy' David Hamilton and Tony Dortie, Pan's People dancer Dee Dee Wilde, Arthur Brown, Cheryl Baker from Bucks Fizz, and backstage crew from across the decades

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show

programme.title: A Country Life for Half the Price with Kate Humble
programme.desc: Kate meets a Hemel Hempstead couple starting a new life in a traditional Welsh farmhouse, and plan to make the 31 acres of land that come with the property work for them by building glamping pods and keeping pigs, cows, sheep and chickens. However, before they can even get started, a local case of TB threatens to derail their entire project, and a wet winter and some surprising personal news only add to the obstacles in their path

programme.title: OMG
programme.desc: People using surgery to recapture their lost youth, including a man who feels his suits do not look right on him any more and a woman who wants to have Britain's largest fake breasts. A great grandmother prepares to have her third facelift and a man who has recently returned to the dating scene gets tips from a friend on concealing his wrinkles

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The pals plan a surprise party for Rachel, but her recently separated mother and father show up. To keep the parents apart, the gang decides to have two different gatherings. Comedy, guest starring Marlo Thomas and Ron Leibman

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe catches chickenpox just as her seafaring boyfriend returns home. Joey gets a job at Chandler's company and Monica becomes obsessed with proving Richard is more neurotic than she is. American comedy, guest starring Charlie Sheen

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler becomes enamoured with a woman he meets on the internet, and the subject of children proves a thorny one for Monica and Richard. Rachel relives the ordeal of her failed wedding day while serving as bridesmaid at her former fiance's ceremony. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers pursue a fleeing Vauxhall Astra through the streets of north Hartlepool at more than 100mph, but are forced to call the chase off and the driver later robs a supermarket at knife-point, sparking a huge manhunt. Liam and his sniffer dog Louie take part in the search of a house that uncovers thousands in cash and nearly £500,000 in class A drugs, while firearms officers rush to Guisborough at 11pm on a Friday after a caller claims that a man with a shotgun is walking around the town

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Nottinghamshire's finest are back with a bang as the interceptors clash with a runaway driver in one of the most epic police pursuits ever caught on camera

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Deputy governor Debbie Whittingham and yeoman gaoler Rob Fuller have spotted an impressive visitor berthed across the river from the Tower - it's a Japanese warship, which is on a world tour and is stopping off in the capital. Meanwhile, Historic Royal Palaces chief curator Tracy Borman investigates the bridges that connect the Tower to the south side of the Thames, including London Bridge and Tower Bridge

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: A focus on the events of June 2022, which saw the Platinum Jubilee weekend and the celebration of Elizabeth II's 70 years on the throne. In the Tower's gift shop, sales assistant and royal superfan Allen Jones has been doing a roaring trade in Jubilee memorabilia. Meanwhile, senior official General the Lord Nicholas Houghton is preparing to retire. He reflects on his time living in such an extraordinary building

programme.title: Prince Albert: Consort & Confidante
programme.desc: Drama-documentary charting the life of Queen Victoria's husband, examining his role as a driving force behind the industrial revolution, a leading influence on British culture, and a campaigner for the welfare of the country's working class communities. As nine pregnancies took their toll on the queen's health, Albert was driven to take up a far more active role until his early death at the age of 42

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: A visit to the oldest ice-cream parlour in Weymouth, where Fulvio and Aimee Figliolini are carrying on the family tradition, and a nearby water garden, transformed from a clay pit in the 1950s and now home to 300 varieties of water lily. Plus, the Blue Pool Nature Reserve on the Isle of Purbeck, and the Dorset Heavy Horse Farm, where Richard Street and his daughter Taya look after their family of heavy horses. Known for their size and strength, these magnificent gentle giants were relied upon for their pulling power before mechanisation took over

programme.title: Budget Hotels: Too Good to Be True?
programme.desc: Alexis Conran looks at the best and worst hotels the UK has to offer, hearing stories of nightmare stays, exposing the tricks of owners and revealing which online reviews to trust. Alexis also talks to a leading bedbug expert on how not to get bitten and visits a 'ghost hotel'

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: TV presenters Amanda Lamb and Matt Tebbutt try out motorhoming as future holiday options for their families, taking a hair-raising ride around the Cotswolds. After 15 years of saving, Jane and Andrew have bought their dreamvehicle and are off to Europe to explore a number of Unesco world heritage sites, taking a detour on their way to the Folkestone ferry to visit Blenheim Palace

programme.title: Rich Holiday, Poor Holiday
programme.desc: Return of the documentary in which people from different sides of the wealth divide trade vacations. In the opening edition, support worker Cheryl and her factory employee son Harvey trade holidays with entrepreneur friends Marco and Paul, with Cheryl and Harvey jetting off to the super-rich playground of Dubai, while Marco and Paul go motorhoming in Surrey and Southend-on-Sea.

programme.title: A&E After Dark
programme.desc: A woman arrives by air ambulance after falling 30ft off a castle wall and is rushed to the CT scanner to check for any life-threatening internal injuries, while a 68-year-old man in Minors is losing a lot of blood after cutting his hand on a broken glass at home. Dr Ibraheem treats a 25-year-old who has had a nasty accident while out walking his dog, with X-rays showing that he has ripped his shoulder out of joint

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: After a knife falls out of a criminal's pocket in Bedford, it takes three officers to get him in handcuffs, while a policeman in King's Lynn is knocked out cold after a pubgoer launches an unprovoked and shocking attack. In Bradford a wanted youth decides not to come quietly and starts fighting with an officer - with both ending up falling through the door of a shop

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Laura, 29, has an incurable brain tumour. To extend her life, she needs it removed, but there is a catch. In order to make sure that all the tumour is removed, surgeon Ismail Urghratdar must sacrifice tissue from a healthy part of Laura's brain - the hippocampus - which is responsible for storing memory

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: A Country Life for Half the Price with Kate Humble
programme.desc: Kate meets Charlie and Sammy Khalil, who are bidding farewell to their terraced house in Bracknell, Berkshire for a detached home in Aberdeenshire, complete with outbuildings and an acre of land. With the house sale completed and everything - including their pet rabbits and cats - packed, it's time for the 600-mile journey to what they hope will be a better life

programme.title: The Funny Thing About
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas presents a whistle-stop tour of awkward, embarrassing and cringeworthy holiday moments, as related by a selection of comedians and celebrities. Johnny's famous contributors skewer the traditional staycation, questioning the perks of rain-drenched British beaches, and whether anyone really likes going camping. Turning their attention further afield, the stars share some of their most memorable holiday tales, including transforming a hotel corridor into one long 'slip-and-slide', the suspicious discovery of a pair of chicken fillets in a swimming pool in Marbella, and a blush-inducing incident involving a naked paragliding session along a Spanish beachfront

programme.title: House Doctor

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working in the Australian rainforest and gets the chance to be very useful when fire strikes and he helps the ranger rescue the koalas

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Humdinger creates fake emergencies for his kitties to save, so that they can appear to be better than the PAW Patrol. However, the plan soon goes awry

programme.title: Patrick (2018)
programme.desc: A young woman's chaotic life becomes more complicated when she inherits her grandmother's dog. Comedy, starring Beattie Edmondson, Ed Skrein, Jennifer Saunders and Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2 (2015)
programme.desc: Dracula is worried that his half-human grandson is not showing any vampiric tendencies, so enlists the help of his fellow monsters in showing the youngster how it is done. The count is shocked to receive an unwelcome visit from his own father, who does not approve of his son's tolerance of humans. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: First Men in the Moon (1964)
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts (1963)
programme.desc: The son of an overthrown king must embark on an epic sea voyage in search of the fabled Golden Fleece so he can return and reclaim his kingdom. Before he can seize the treasure, he has to overcome a series of horrific creatures, including a seven-headed monster and a horde of sword-wielding skeletons. Mythological fantasy adventure, starring Todd Armstrong, Honor Blackman, Nancy Kovack, Niall MacGinnis and Patrick Troughton, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham (2002)
programme.desc: An English schoolgirl tries to hide her passion for football from her strict Indian parents, knowing they disapprove of her tomboyish love of the game. However, when a semi-professional player sees her in action, she is offered a place on a team, forcing her to come up with a complex plan to keep her sporting career under wraps. Comedy, with Parminder Nagra, Keira Knightley, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Juliet Stevenson and Shaznay Lewis

programme.title: Infinite (2021)
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence (2001)
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his 'mother', he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances O'Connor

programme.title: The Shallows (2016)
programme.desc: A surfer strays into the hunting territory of a great white shark, and finds herself stranded on a tiny island a mere 200 yards from the shore. With the deadly aquatic predator between her and the beach and her safe haven slowly disappearing as the tide comes in, she faces a life or death struggle to get safely back to dry land. Thriller, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada

programme.title: Snoopy and Charlie Brown: The Peanuts Movie (2015)
programme.desc: The long-suffering youngster hopes his lifelong run of bad luck will come to an end when he develops a crush on a new schoolfriend. His beloved dog has more important things to worry about, as he dreams of taking to the skies in his airborne kennel. Animated comedy, with the voices of Noah Schnapp and Bill Melendez

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation (2018)
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee (1986)
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding (1997)
programme.desc: A food critic realises she is in love with her best friend just as he announces he is going to marry another woman. Determined to have him to herself, she heads for the wedding with the intention of sabotaging the ceremony - but persuading the groom to give up on his bride-to-be proves harder than expected. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Sister Act (1992)
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: 12 Strong (2018)
programme.desc: The story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11. Under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban. War drama, based on Doug Stanton's non-fiction book Horse Soldiers, starring Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon and Michael Pena

programme.title: Overlord (2018)
programme.desc: In 1944, a group of American soldiers land in an occupied French hamlet after their plane is destroyed by enemy fire. Their mission is to take out a heavily fortified Nazi radio tower hours before D-Day. However, they stumble across a mysterious Nazi lab where their bloodthirsty enemies are waiting for them. Action thriller from producer JJ Abrams, starring Jovan Adepo, Wyatt Russell and Mathilde Ollivier

programme.title: Escape from New York (1981)
programme.desc: Former special forces soldier Snake Plissken is sentenced to life on Manhattan Island, an anarchic penal colony for the most dangerous criminals. When Air Force One is hijacked and crashes there, Snake is coerced into rescuing the US president from prisoners holding him hostage. John Carpenter's sci-fi action adventure, with Kurt Russell, Donald Pleasence, Lee Van Cleef, Adrienne Barbeau and Isaac Hayes

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad (1958)
programme.desc: The heroic sailor pits his wits against an evil magician who has shrunk a princess to the size of a doll - but to break the spell, he must journey to a mysterious island inhabited by hideous monsters and find a magic lamp. Fantasy adventure, starring Kerwin Mathews, Kathryn Grant and Torin Thatcher, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: The Golden Child (1986)
programme.desc: A private eye is recruited by a group of Buddhist mystics and sent on a mission to rescue an abducted boy whose supernatural powers will enable him to bring about world peace. However, the kidnapper is actually a demon in human form, determined to ensure the youngster does not fulfil his destiny. Comedy fantasy adventure, starring Eddie Murphy, Charles Dance and Charlotte Lewis

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993)
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back (2016)
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: Glass (2019)
programme.desc: An invulnerable vigilante battles a murderer with multiple personalities - only for both to be apprehended and transferred to a mental hospital. They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalan's fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Custody (2017)
programme.desc: An outwardly respectable father enters a custody battle for access to his estranged family, but his ex-wife and children seem extremely frightened of him. Writer/director Xavier Legrand's drama, starring Lea Drucker and Denis Menochet. In French

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ella's sweet sixteen birthday party doesn't go to plan when Shing Lin takes to the microphone and Ste intervenes when James won't back down from his feud with the McQueens. Charlie finds some hope but Darren is keeping secrets. Dillon and Lucas play Cupid

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie receives some bad news and Warren and Ella bond over when they receive an uninvited visitor at the garage. Darren comes clean to Charlie about what the doctor said

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Denver, Colorado, where he meets the stubborn owner of Italian restaurant Pantaleone's, who appears to be firmly stuck in the past. Pete maintains he makes the best pizza in town - based on a review from the 1980s - but the fiery chef's own taste test proves the opposite. With Pete's wife Paulette and son Josh threatening to leave, can Gordon get through to him and save the business?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Arvada, Colorado, where a husband and wife have allowed their restaurant to fall into disrepair. Randy's hoarding is out of control, while Alexa, who runs the kitchen, has a lot to learn. To make matters worse, the Old Neighborhood is one of the filthiest eateries the fiery chef has ever seen, and only one of the biggest transformations of the series can save the business

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw's gambling room becomes a success, while Sheldon dips his toe in the stock market and Missy starts a business

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Georgie comes clean to Mandy, while Sheldon gets an odd request from old friend Paige, and George Sr and Mary are caught in the middle of Meemaw and Dale's breakup

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to set a new record on a training course, Diaz does not receive an invitation to Boyle's wedding, and Holt becomes addicted to a game application on his smartphone. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle asks Peralta to be his best man, but as well as helping out with cake-tasting and choosing invitations, he must also persuade the groom to start standing up to Vivian before the big day. Holt helps Diaz make a sincere apology and Jeffords, Santiago and Gina embark on a tough new diet - but struggle to stick to it

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Andre persuades Phil to make a spontaneous purchase when the friends go car shopping, and Jay is determined to take Gloria and Manny to his high-school reunion. Meanwhile, Mitch and Cameron face an uphill struggle to console a distraught Lily, who loses her favourite soft toy on a train. Guest starring Kevin Hart (Death at a Funeral)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The families take a trip to Disneyland, where Mitch and Cameron are forced to cope with Lily's new-found love of running, and Jay and Gloria argue over sensible footwear. Meanwhile, Claire is far from pleased when she bumps into Haley's ex-boyfriend Dylan, and Phil struggles to keep up with Luke

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj after he is forced to move out of his apartment to save money, leading to unexpected conflict among the gang and some unwanted observations from Leonard's mother. Christine Baranski guests

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, but Penny and Raj get along so well together that Leonard starts to feel left out. Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's work and they begin to collaborate on a scientific project

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newark) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Raj's old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Tina struggles to keep up with her job at Calvin's garage due to her burgeoning baking business, he faces a tough decision

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin splurges on an expensive jacket, then worries it's too special to risk wearing outside the house. Dave and Gemma worry their new friends' daughter is a bad influence

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A family trip to the school fair proves eventful for Phil and Claire, while Haley's relaxing day by the pool is interrupted by an awkward encounter with 'manny' Andy and Jay is unimpressed when Gloria signs him up for 'cop duties'

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire head to ClosetCon'13, a trade show for the closet industry, providing the perfect opportunity for Phil to find out what his father-in-law is storing in his secret room. Cam takes Lily and Mitch to the Tucker family farm, though he does not bargain on a visit from Grams (guest star Ann Guilbert), who is known for her homophobia. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Eighty-year-old Rose has fluid on her lungs and is having trouble breathing. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: After many years of hard work, Debbie and Nick from Salford believe the time is right to buy a holiday home close to the traditional Spanish town of Dénia on the Costa Blanca. Spectacular views at the top of the couple's wish list, so armed with a budget of £150,000, Laura Hamilton sets out to line up five options for them to consider

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of the musically themed Harmony B&B in Torquay, Devon, begin the competition, trying to prove their establishment offers the best value for money. Dutch hosts Hans MacDaniel and Monica van der Meij try to impress their guests, but it remains to be seen what they will make of wheelchair badminton, saxophones at breakfast and a controversial sausage

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at Chimneys B&B in North Walsham, Norfolk, where owners Jenny and Richard Harmer's decision to use a flag as a tablecloth angers Hans MacDaniel and Monica Van Der Meij. The argument seems to abate during an afternoon canoeing session - only to resurface at breakfast the following day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Beverley Conoley and Caroline Pocklington host at the Wordsworth Hotel in Cockermouth, Cumbria. They take their guests to a spa and Hans MacDaniel happily volunteers for a spray tan, while Richard Harmer is far more uncomfortable as he finds himself on a massage table. The day ends with dinner at a nearby bistro, but Jenny Harmer complains about the temperature

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Lesley and Emily Gray play host at the Park Farm Guest House in Gateshead, but while the evening's entertainment featuring a ride on a two-wheeled personal transporter goes down well among the guests, tensions simmer when the dinner conversation turns to a delicate issue

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining four teams tackle the challenges thrown at them in Chocolate Week. They begin by making 24 fruity chocolate desserts alongside 24 desserts celebrating autumn using chocolate. In the showpiece challenge, the teams each create 48 safari-themed chocolate bars to go within a piece with a moving part

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Swansea, performing arts director Anthony plans a theatre-themed menu for his guests, Ross, Tula, Kola and Julie. However, straight-talking Tula tries to steal the show with a candid revelation and Julie brings the house down with some frisky fun at Kola's expense. Anthony's plans go awry in the kitchen, threatening to earn him more rotten earn tomatoes than rave reviews

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Salesman Ross hosts the second party from Swansea, but his guests make a discovery that leaves him with some explaining to do, while tension erupts between him and Kola

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Triathlete Tula serves a Spanish-themed menu in Swansea, hoping charm and chorizo can smooth over the dispute between Ross and Julie and avoid a punch-up over the paella

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Social worker Julie plans a chilled out slumber party for the final night of the week in Swansea. She cooks a homely menu, but struggles with the pronunciation as well as the preparation of some of her ingredients. At the end of another eventful evening, the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Revival of the series in which celebrities take Fred Sirieix to experience dining at their favourite restaurants. In the first episode, Fred and Dermot O'Leary explore Puglia's food culture, visiting restaurants that celebrate Puglia's fabled cucina povera, or poor man's cooking

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany arrives by boat in Bodrum, Turkey, and gains unprecedented access to the recently unearthed tomb of the leader of a remarkable dynasty from the 4th century BCE. At Patara, she finds a building with connections to the American constitution and finds the city to be the hometown of St Nicholas, also known as Father Christmas. She also investigates exciting new developments at the world-famous site of Troy where she reveals the truth behind the tales of the Trojan War

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff at King's College Hospital treat patients on Valentine's Day, including a 53-year-old psychologist who has injured his shoulder in a motorcycle accident. His partner is abroad and he doesn't want to worry her, so he decides to keep the incident a secret. Also in the A&E department are a man with a bleed on the brain and an elderly widower who has been bitten by his dog

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Abby has had an accident at a diving pool and needs to have her head and neck scanned for serious injuries. Worried mum Nikki puts on a brave face while doctors perform tests, but dad Scott is stuck hundreds of miles away in Scotland. Meanwhile, Anne and Holton - part of a security team dealing with more than 50 incidents a month - encounter a variety of challenging patients on the night shift at King's College Hospital in London

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

He proposes a radical revamp, to be done in stages as finances allow. But with another baby on the way, Darren is keen for the family to get the most space possible now. With money running out and the roof leaking, will the refurb be completed in time for the new arrival?

He then heads to Oshawa to look around the home of the McLaughlin family, who helped build a new economy for Canada, before his journey across Canada concludes in Toronto

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to explore more of the US rail network, embarking on the first leg of a journey across Alaska. He begins his journey amid the snow-capped mountains of the Kenal Peninsula, where he discovers that 150 years ago, Alaska was a Russian colony. Moving on, in Seward he feeds a rescued sea otter with a fearsome bite and in Anchorage he joins the US Arctic Warriors for parachute training

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to explore Alaska, from the remote former goldrush settlement of Talkeetna to the railwayless state capital, Juneau. Along the way, he helps a homesteader fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin, discovers how 100 years ago photographers captured the beauty of the Alaskan landscape and meets scientists studying the Northern Lights

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The next leg of Michael Portillo's journey begins in Skagway, Alaska, where he learns about writer Jack London, one of the gold prospectors who hiked to the Klondike 100 years ago. He then crosses into Canada on the White Pass and Yukon railway. Along the way he is invited to shake his tail feathers in a grouse dance, heads for the home of the Vancouver Giants, tries his hand at ice hockey and visits the Canadian Motion Picture Park

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores British Columbia, discovering how two superpowers nearly came to war over a pig and joining the Royal Canadian Navy to firefight on board the frigate HMCS Regina. He also explores the rich British heritage and colonial past of Victoria - the provincial capital of British Columbia - discovers the origins of the Hudson's Bay Company, helps to carve a 36- foot totem pole and learns how to head off a charging bear

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards one of the world's most famous trains, the Rocky Mountaineer, to cross the backbone of the North American continent from Kamloops to the spa resort of Banff. This magnificent journey takes him to the highest point of the 19th century transcontinental Canadian Pacific Railway line at Kicking Horse Pass, past Lake Louise and inside spiral tunnels blasted through the mountains. Along the way, Michael hears of the harsh and dangerous conditions endured by the Chinese and European labourers who built the railway, and looks back at the historic driving of the Last Spike, which completed the Canadian Pacific Railway in 1885

programme.title: Porridge

programme.title: Porridge

programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. From Slovenia, Chris heads east along an old Austro-Hungarian railway that was once used by the Orient Express, pays a visit to a very unusual railway-related battlefield in Bosnia and rides on one of the world's great mountain railways on his way to the Serbian capital Belgrade before finishing his journey in Montenegro

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Bomber Command is unable to hit its targets precisely and attacks German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, Michael Portillo rediscovers a once-famous poet in Nottingham and travels on a railway line resurrected by popular demand after falling victim to Beeching's cuts. He finds out how Doncaster rail workers shaped British political history, before reaching his final destination of Leeds, where he auditions at Britain's oldest continuously working music hall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made. He then heads to Bristol Zoo, examines an extraordinary piece of Victorian engineering at Severn Tunnel Junction and ends the leg in Gloucester, where he meets a stonemason at the city's cathedral

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey from Southampton to the West Midlands, Michael Portillo visits the spa town of Cheltenham, where he gets behind the wheel of a very early locomotive carriage that ran on the road. In Tewkesbury, he joins a group re-enacting a battle from the Wars of the Roses, before he reaches his final destination of Wolverhampton, where he hears how Queen Victoria made an emotional visit that signalled the end of her exile from public life after mourning Prince Albert

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: Newcastle United v Aston Villa (Kick-off 5.30pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from St. James' Park, as both teams get their top-flight campaign underway. Villa did get their revenge in the reverse fixture, winning 3-0 at home

programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.desc: Chelsea v Liverpool (Kick-off 4.30pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from Stamford Bridge, as Mauricio Pochettino takes charge of the Blues for the first time in the top flight. The last six meetings between the two sides have ended in draws, including both domestic cup finals in 2022 that Liverpool went on to win on penalties. Both teams will be looking to improve on relatively poor seasons, which saw them finish 12th and 5th
